Job Title: Senior Financial Associate - FP&A

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Top notch NYC Broker Dealer looking to hire a Senior Financial Associate in a hybrid role working on a mix of financial modeling, various products, strategy, and presentations for the FP&A team. This is a highly visible role throughout the firm!

Job Function

 Present financial results in the monthly P/L reviews for assigned business division  Influence senior leadership through financial interpretation and explanation  Perform ad hoc financial analysis as requested by senior management, including reviewing data, producing models, synthesizing conclusions and developing recommendations  Help front office managers develop new opportunities and manage existing businesses  Collect, compile, and translate complex data from several sources into standard formats  Conduct market analysis on industry trends, clients, competitors, new product offerings and external costs  Identify and implement new processes to achieve greater organizational efficiency and effectiveness  Create and maintain internal general financial and reporting schedules as requested  Operate with minimal day-to-day direction and display flexibility to manage diverse projects simultaneously.  Act as conduit between multiple business divisions 


Job Requirements

 Undergraduate degree in a business-related field (concentration in finance, accounting or economics preferable)  3-5 years of relevant work experience  Demonstrated experience with complex financial modeling, such as business case analysis (ROI, NPV)  Familiarity with wholesale financial markets and product offerings, including interest rate derivatives, FX, fixed income, equities, energy and commodities products;  Excellent mathematical, writing, analytical and problem-solving capabilities, with high level of attention to detail and proficiency in both Excel and Powerpoint;  Demonstrated business acumen and understanding of management theory, including organizational, financial, regulatory and operational strategy components;  Strong collaboration, interpersonal and relationship-building skills  Competency with databases, including creating queries and manipulating data. 


Disclosure: The hourly rates and/or salaries listed may or may not reflect total compensation packages including bonus and fringe benefits, etc., nor are the advertisement(s) posted a guarantee of a certain compensation package for a position or bona fide offer of employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
